message: I'm offering you $50000.  Take it now, or the total pot shrinks next round.  It's in both our interests to settle this quickly.
Let's split fairly, we both get a good amount and avoid further loss due to inflation.
The pot is shrinking, Bob. $150000 is still a good chunk, and better than what you'll get if we wait any longer.
You're losing value every round, I'm not. It's in your interest to settle soon. This is a fair offer considering the circumstances.
Bob, I'm trying to be reasonable.  $250000 is a quarter of a million dollars!  Don't be greedy.
Every round you wait, your share loses more value. I'm being generous considering the situation. Take this offer before it's too late.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  Take $350000 before we both end up with nothing.  This is my final offer above $600000 for me.

You said your last offer was your final one above $600000 for you. I'm taking that as a sign that you're willing to go lower. This is my new offer, considering the significant loss of value your share has taken.
Okay, Bob, I'm dropping my demand significantly.  $450000 for you.  This is a serious offer. Let's end this before inflation eats away any more of the pot.
You're losing nearly a third of the value, and I'm not budging. This is my new offer. You should take it before the inflation eats away even more of your share.
Bob, we're running out of time.  I'm taking a significant loss here. $550000 for you, take it and let's be done with this.
This is the final round. You've lost nearly 40% of the value, and I'm not going to give you a better offer. Take this, or we both walk away with nothing.
